item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, February 27, 2025 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: I got laid off from Meta and created a minor hit on Steam (979 points | 221 comments)
2. Winners of the $10k ISBN visualization bounty (290 points | 20 comments)
3. Show HN: Libredesk – Open-source customer support desk. Single binary app (89 points | 15 comments)
4. TypeScript types can run DOOM [video] (1038 points | 267 comments)
5. iMac G4(K) (246 points | 102 comments)
6. DualPipe: Bidirectional pipeline parallelism algorithm (101 points | 15 comments)
7. Teslas monitor everything – including you [video] from WIRED (58 points | 21 comments)
8. US examining whether UK's encryption demand on Apple broke data treaty (20 points | 5 comments)
9. Launch HN: Maritime Fusion (YC W25) – Fusion Reactors for Ships (184 points | 191 comments)
10. Show HN: Tach – Visualize and untangle your Python codebase (200 points | 46 comments)
11. Geometric Algebra (99 points | 16 comments)
12. Show HN: A Database Written in Golang (201 points | 57 comments)
13. Flawed Diamonds Make Perfect Quantum Sensors (6 points | discuss)
14. Simulating Time in Square-Root Space (71 points | 12 comments)
15. The man who spent forty-two years at the Beverly Hills Hotel pool (1993) (193 points | 155 comments)
16. Replace OCR with Vision Language Models (205 points | 76 comments)
17. Cross Views (144 points | 107 comments)
18. Tom Stevenson on the deciphering of Linear Elamite (71 points | 14 comments)
19. Show HN: LLM plays Pokémon (open sourced) (142 points | 46 comments)
20. The FFT Strikes Back: An Efficient Alternative to Self-Attention (403 points | 151 comments)
21. Show HN: Breakout with a roguelite/vampire survivor twist (292 points | 129 comments)
22. A new proposal for how mind emerges from matter (134 points | 117 comments)
23. DARPA Large Bio-Mechanical Space Structures (166 points | 67 comments)
24. Chartist: Task-Driven Eye Movement Control for Chart Reading (5 points | 1 comment)
25. Writing a .NET Garbage Collector in C# – Part 1 (68 points | 9 comments)
26. ForeverVM: Run AI-generated code in stateful sandboxes that run forever (141 points | 42 comments)
27. Show HN: I created a language called AntiLang – breaking all the conventions (89 points | 61 comments)
28. Long division verified via Hoare logic (84 points | 45 comments)
29. Rediscovering Quaternions (95 points | 57 comments)
30. A Comprehensive Formal Security Analysis of OAuth 2.0 (31 points | 2 comments)
